page.title: 08Collingb'ne Dairy Farming
page.content: The grass fields surrounding Collingbourne Kingston are used by a herd of milking cows which are milked by a milking bale which is a mobile milking parlour. The herd consists of 140_160 Freisian/Hereford cows with a Simmental Bull. Two men milk these cows twice a day. The milk is cooled in a bulk tank in a dairy and the Milk Marketing Board collects it once a day. This is then taken by road to Kent where it is bottled for doorstep delivery. The milking bale will move around the farm during the year as required following the cows which stay outside all year. The cows will eat hay, silage, straw (treated with caustic soda to make it more palatable), kale, rolled oats, barley and soya beans.
